#2. ğŸŒ Butter

Less than ten hours this time but I scrapped 3 or 4 songs before this was done. It's clear already that Ableton isn't the problem, commiting to musical ideas is. The drums are audio, sequenced by hand which seemed to work well because I was forced to hear what I wanted before just diving in. Best moment was taking out sections of guitar and hearing the song get bigger.

Writing in mono really helped. I caught myself mixing too early a couple times. I didn't apply any fx to the guitar or bass until all the parts were in. Definitely the move. I'm going to commit to my first idea next time even if it's garbage.
